column1: "lead_paragraph": "A severe but largely technical credit squeeze enveloped the money market yesterday
column2: causing interbank overnight funds to trade between 9 percent and 10.5 percent all day. Elsewhere
column3: dealers reported minimal price changes on the last trading day of 1985. While most government securities dealers were closing their books early
column4: the Federal Reserve's money transfer wires were humming well into the evening. Earlier
column5: the Fed tried to directly alleviate the demand for credit through two-day system repurchase agreements."

column2: the reputed leader of organized crime in Milwaukee
column3: pleaded guilty today to conspiracy and racketeering and was sentenced to 10 years in prison. He had been standing trial in Federal District Court on charges of skimming money from casinos before the money was recorded on the casinos' books."

column1: "snippet": "  Libya today denied involvement in the Vienna and Rome airport attacks and said remarks by the United States and Israeli officials were evidence of intended ''joint aggression against Libya by the American military machine and by Israel.''   Israel..."

"lead_paragraph": "Libya today denied involvement in the Vienna and Rome airport attacks and said remarks by the United States and Israeli officials were evidence of intended ''joint aggression against Libya by the American military machine and by Israel.'' Israel has threatened retaliation after the attacks on its airline check-in counters at the two airports. United States officials have said that military measures against terrorists were not excluded."
"main": "LIBYANS DENY A CONNECTION TO TERRORISM AT 2 AIRPORTS"

column1: "lead_paragraph": "Jorge Velasquez misjudged the finish of the Display Handicap yesterday
column4: after crossing the line as the leader with a mile to be run in the two-and-a-quarter-mile race. His mount went on to finish a badly beaten sixth in the field of nine."
